intro: Derris eualata, commonly known as the white spurge or white milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish flowers. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Derris eualata is used in traditional medicine but requires caution due to its potentially harmful properties.
